reviews.review_msg: Very helpful prof and responds to emails fast. A lot to memorize for the written portion of exams. 5-6 questions out of 30 marks will be chosen randomly. You need to memorize basically word for word to get perfect. The multiple choice is easy. Exact same questions from the quizzes. Weekly quizzes can be difficult due to time restrictions.

Dayna gives great feedback on weekly assignments and she genuinely wants her students to do well. The textbook material is quite dense, but if you pay attention to her studying suggestions then it's fairly easy to do well on the midterm and final. Need to keep up with the textbook readings to do well on the weekly quizzes, but thats pretty standard

Online class. Group projects are annoying and necessary. Midterm and final, not cumulative. Based 100% on textbook. Short answer questions are given to you but must memorize about 20 (between 1-15 marks) of them to only write 5 on tests.

Dayna is great! She is very helpful and kind. Take the course with her! The material is very interesting and she makes it a great learning experience. Would take this course again or any other course she teaches! You need to study for the midterm and final but she is fair. Very nice and approachable! Take the course with her!!

I wish I had gotten to take this course in class since I find the material really interesting, but I must say it was really easy taking it online. Weekly quizzes and discussions, midterms/finals are all questions pulled from the online test bank so if you study that you're solid!
The online quizzes were a little weird, maybe it was the language used? But it didn't seem to relate to the topic much, and was very focused on different studies rather than overall concepts.

Took the online section with an amazing TM! Very supportive and usually answers emails quickly and very thoroughly. Each chapter is followed by a quiz - it's easy if you understood said chapter. There are also group discussions each week - it is not difficult. Be sure to review the short answer questions for the midterm and final prep!

Deborah is very knowledge and her tests are very straight forward! If you put in the time and effort, you'll do well and learn a lot of interesting things in the class! There are also quizzes every week but it is very easy since the questions are all online. Highly recommend!
Dr. Connolly was extremely friendly, and facilitated discussion. Her tests were extremely fair; all of the answers were given to us on canvas. It seems as if she really values her students.

This class is great, and if are good at memorization then it can be a big GPA booster. There is no paper, just exams, weekly quizzes and weekly discussions. Dr. Connolly is a good lecturer, and has other profs come in from time to time to teach their own specialties. She is also very friendly and approachable if you need help.

Probably one of the nicest professors I've had. She encourages thought provoking questions and is very clear and precise when answering questions. Good overall lecturer, and the class content is interesting! I would recommend this class because all of her questions are taken from a test bank which she provides you at the beginning of the course.

If you like psychology or law, this class will be a huge GPA booster for you. Questions and answers for IClicker are all online in the quiz bank, and the exact same questions are used on the midterm and final. The short answer questions and answers are also online, so you know exactly what she expects. Discussions, IClicker, and exams are all easy.

Not sure why her ratings are pretty low on here. Her quizzes and exams are very straightforward, taken from an exam bank online that is available for us to practice. Discussions/ participation marks are also straightforward and easy as long as you contribute. one of the easiest classes i've taken & she's very engaging.

Deborah has a passion for teaching. She is extremely knowledgeable in her field, and she explains the material in a very clear way. The issue with her class is the grading method. Many students memorize the whole textbook, which time consuming. This is unnecessary because one only needs to memorize the practice exams, and you'd get an A.

Took this class bc I work full time & need flexibility. Not what I got. There was a DIFFICULT quiz & group assignment EVERY week. Have to rely on others to actually participate otherwise you're doing your own assignment every single week. Short answer questions for tests basically impossible to get more than 50-60%, have to memorize every word.

This was not an easy class. You have to stay on top of readings, and there are  discussions and quizzes due every week. Exams are very tough, as you are expected to know all of the material from the textbook as well as memorize the short answer summaries given for each chapter. Lots of work, but definitely prepares you for upper level courses.

She really engaged the class and seemed very interested in what she was saying.  Very knowledgeable but willing to admit when she didnt know something.  Possibly one of the best professor I have had in three years.

A ridiculous amount of information that you have to memorize EXACTLY to get full points. I don't know many people that got full points on any of the long answer questions. Everything is examinable. This is a 2nd year class with 4th year expectations. I would highly recommend avoiding this class unless you need to take it.

Took this online. Very boring course. The content is pretty straightforward but you will have to remember it word for word for short answer questions. Got a really good grade but i wouldn't recommend this course to anyone. Online discussions and weekly assignment was a pain. MC portion of the exam is easy if you do the weekly quizzes and review it.

She does go off her lecture notes entirely, and testing seems to mainly surround these notes. However, she did write the notes in the first place, so i don't see why everyone has a problem with this. Easy to do well if you attend (small quiz/group assign every week) and if you read lecture notes that are posted. Helpful and very knowledgable

Took this class distance, huge GPA killer. Required you to memorize everything word for word and weekly TIMED quizzes are absolute BS. Questions were extremely confusing and unfair. You only pass the quiz it you get 7/10 or higher, sounds easy but these quizzes are brutal!

She is nice but completely useless as a prof. she reads off her lectures and is ABSOLUTELY lost without them. her exams are PURE regurgitation, so if ur good at memorizing EVERY SINGLE WORD (word for word, no joke) then shes the prof for u. unless u have the exact same thing she has on her marking sheet, u dont get the mark. avoid if u can

Asks for unreasonably detailed questions that bear no significance to the subject; Made it feel like a law course though it was labelled PSYC. I sympathize with you if this is a compulsory course for you, and if it isn't, you'd be crazy to take it.

Great prof!! Of course there was a lot of material to be covered, it was a reading intensive course. Those who complain are most likely lazy students. if you work hard you'll get an A. Very pleasant demeanor.

Ruined all expectations for what would have otherwise been an engaging subject. Reads powerpoint slides for the entire lecture while everyone sits and zone out! Demands an unrealistic level of detail for exams requiring that you remember minute details of legal code. Unless you can read and remember the encyclopedia, I advise against this course.

Worst professor! Again, high GPA student and this is the only class where I have suffered. The exams are incredibly hard (3rd/4th year level questions), and she does not help it by not only making everything examinable, but her lecture notes are not helpful at all. The textbook is fine to study but when you're looking at her lecture notes to see wh
Dr. Connolly is the BEST TEACHER EVER!!! She made everything super interesting and easy to comprehend. I'd recommend this class to anybody. She rawks!!

worst teacher i have ever had, most boring class and the exmans were beyond comphrension... they were very difficult, my gpa is 3.0 and i got a c- in the class!!! a SECOND YEAR CLASS!dont bother she is a terrible teacher and marker

This class was insane! The 1st midterm was pretty hard. The 2nd midterm was alright. The final was RIDICULOUS! Her lectures are interesting. They are easy to follow. But there is alot of information covered which is ALL examinable. Exam questions are quite specific. Dr. Connolly is a great person. But as a prof, she is difficult. Be careful!

If u have a large memory capacity, then take the course, her midterm 1 was definitely HARD, midterm 2 was fine..cuz everybody is studying harder..FINAL...VERY HARD, Cumulative (MC, SHORT ANS) She's nice but she go too fast on her lectures, u might have to listen to her digital lectures again, most questions on test are from lectures! >_<

LOVED Dr. Douglas!!! I took psyc268 with him in fall 2023 and let's just say I think about it non-stop-- especially after taking psyc379. Sad to see he's on leave currently, but hopefully he will be back at the university soon because I would love to take more classes he teaches during my time left in undergrad!

kevin is an excellent professor. classes were early in the morning and i would make the effort to drive from surrey at 6am everyday to be on time but it was so worth it. a professor can really make or break a class. kept his class interested. i had to switch universities but he is one professor from my university experience i will not forget!

Kevin's an excellent professor who cares about students. Lectures are really interesting and applicable, and he provided the textbook for free which was appreciated. Class discussions and questions are encouraged so there was a lot of participation and attendance in this class compared to others. Flexible and fair with assignments-highly recommend.

took this class spring 2020 during covid-19. textbook is provided free. lecture slides are posted but carry minimal info, definitely need to attend lecture and read textbook. Prof. Douglas does try to make lecture entertaining with jokes, definitely not dry & boring. lots of material to study, but if you do so the tests are pretty straightforward

Hes the best I truly enjoyed studying!! Hes so knowledgeable and makes detailed normally not interesting psyc assessments interesting and enjoyable as he is experienced in the field. He has so much personal memories he shares during the lectures, it is one of the classes I didnt get bored at all Cant wait to take another class with him!!!

She was an amazing professor literally you want to go to class, she has interesting lectures. The only thing is that 85% of your mark is from exams, but her exams are fully from lecture slides, it is beyond memorization if you can sit and learn the content you will do excellent. They are a bit hard, but if you study you will do well.

She cares about her students and wants them to succeed. Her midterms and finals are pretty straightforward and are solely based on lectures. No textbook either... I would 100% recommend a class with her :)

This is the highest grade I've ever received, and I am not academically gifted. Dr. Quigley is seriously awesome. If you attend lectures and pay attention, it will be smooth sailing. Also, just wait before buying the textbook. SERIOUSLY ATTEND LECTURE.

I would 100% take any class with her.

I had an enjoyable time in her class, the content taught was very interesting. U can easily get full marks for writing assignments if u put some effort in. Idk if it's still the same now, but I took her class in Fall 2024 & found that most test questions was worded exactly like her PowerPoint slides, so that was how I studied for the midterms/final

Adele is so caring, passionate and wants students to understand the material. Since she is passionate about her topics, her lectures are super engaging. She answers questions with good responses, replies fast and owns up to a mistake if there is. Her powerpoint slides are up beforehand. Best professor at SFU!

She is a very kind prof who is open to feedback. Her lectures were good, but her slides can be confusing if you didn't attend the lecture in person. Had to attend lecture once a week for in-class assignments worth 1% each. Her MCQ on exams are confusing, def study the specific case studies she talks about because she likes to test those.
She is very sweet and understanding. Her lectures are organized and easy to follow. Her exams are quite hard, but the practice quizzes help a lot when studying for them.

Great prof, loved her lectures, but her exams are so poorly written. I've spoken to several other classmates and we've all agreed that she just doesn't know how to write mc questions. Otherwise, loved the course.

I really liked Adele. BUT HER EXAMS ARE WORTH 85% AT A 200 LEVEL COURSE. no thanks. The average of the first midterm was SOOO bad. When I tell you she blamed it on being used to mistakes being okay in her past hometown where she taught; New Zealand. No hate but didn't find I remembered stuff from this class. In-class assignments were a pain low-key

the tests are way too hard. she gives examples of what might be on the midterm and it's not even there, instead its stuff you don't even remember learning. the first midterm was mostly multiple choice which most people did bad on, but the written part was easier to get a better grade so the avg for that was higher, but she removed this for 2nd exam

I loved Dr. Adele's class. She is very kind and compassionate towards all her students and her lectures are very interesting and engaging. We got an option to do extra credit if we asked. In class assignments were quite easy to do as long as you are able to think critically and show up to lectures. Highly recommend taking any class with her.

Dr. Adele is the sweetest professor ever-- you can easily tell that she cares about her students from her openness to feedback, and (upon request) she was more than willing to help students who didn't want to/feel like buying the textbook. Just watch out for her in-class assignments-- they're easy, more to make you think than to test your memory.

took 268 with him spring 2023, now taking 376 spring 2024. absolute favourite prof I've ever had. so charismatic and a great lecturer, keeps up with communication and always makes sure assessments are fair. ryan is literally my celebrity crush and i want him to teach more courses so i can take them with him. ryan if you see this, i love you *mwah*

Would NOT recommend this prof. Lacks empathy, will not help you if you are struggling with personal issues. Exams r way harder than shud be for 2nd year. All ur grade relies on his exams. Would rather find ANY other prof. Worst prof in all of my uni experience. Do not waste ur $ and time.
Ryan is a really good lecturer, I would definitely take another class with him. Grading was based on attendance and 3 exams, but he drops your lowest grade which is very helpful.
Graded by participation and two exams.

They look for very specific answers. The quizzes and exams are timed, which isn't an issue except for the fact that it's 1 min per question. Both prof and TA were not much help when it came to answering questions. The content is very interesting and the weekly quizzes focused on the most important topics which is good. Group assignments too.

very uptight and completely unapproachable. doesn't help with questions regarding the material when asked. both him and the ta's are rude and disrespectful. The material was not difficult at all, it was rather Roesch that made the course navigation immensely difficult.

The time limit on his exams doesn't allow enough time to read all the questions, let alone time to actually think about what the answer is. There's a difference between preventing cheating and just setting students up for failure. He made a ld course so unnecessarily difficult, harder than upper division courses. Avoid.

My favourite course has been PSYC268 with professor Roesch. The exams, assignments, and quizzes were completely fair. He highlighted the most important material in lecture, and gave a good idea of what to know for exams. If you attend lectures and read the textbook, you'll do great. Very put together.

This class was very interesting! There were 3 exams as well as weekly quizzes, which were not too hard as long as you read the textbook and studied lecture notes. There were also weekly group in class assignments which were a little more difficult. Overall, this class was not difficult as long as you studied.

Do not take this class with this prof. Very unreasonable and a really tough marker. Both he and the TA's expect a lot and the exams are very hard (have to know every detail from the textbook). I went to ask for help and he only was asking about my marks and not helping me improve.

The prof did not tell us that the class would be curved, so it was a surprise to everyone when their grades were lower than expected. Avoid Yan Lim as a TA if you can - her quiz Qs are worded confusingly and she asks very specific questions like percentages of a study mentioned in 2 sentences of the text. Very bizarre. Know the text inside out.

All you need to get an A in this course is to reiterate the textbook definitions and studies discussed. His lectures are only a repeat of the text. To get full marks on group assignments, quizzes, and exams - just restate the text. Many questions were copied/pasted sentences from the text ("fill in the blanks"). The course was not engaging at all.

The textbook is necessary for the weekly quizzes, and exams (I suggest you bring it to the tutorials for the assignments). No need to attend lecture, he just reads from the slides provided before class. Exams are memorization of the textbook. Attend tutorial, easy 20% of marks (quizzes & in-class assignments).

Weekly iclicker quizzes straight from textbook, weekly assignments done in tutorial which are an easy 10% of your grade. You have to read the textbook to pass the midterm and final, without reading it you are bound to fail. Lecture's only touch on subjects and more example based. Super interesting class if you're interested in the legal system.

Lectures tended to be boring sometimes but some of the topics covered were interesting. Iclickers every week that require you to read the textbook, in-class assignments were easy to do well on. a lot of material to remember for the exams but they were fair.

A very softspoken, kind and approachable professor. He is very knowledgeable in his field as he has written textbooks, works w/ gov't and many other achievements. Lectures were often boring and tedious. However the exams were fair and based right off the textbooks so it is VERY important you keep up to date and read the textbook word by word.
Good lecturer, midterm based more on textbook than lecture slides

Relevant textbook that was easy to read. lectures tended to be boring because of his monotone voice, but he's passionate about the material. The material was interesting though and exams were fair. Would recommend

Excellent prof! Expectations are clear & no surprises. Exams are fair. Good lecturer & communicates material well. Textbook is extremely well organized and actually interesting to read. He tries to make class better by connecting material to relevant examples, but his voice is a bit monotone. Students applauded for him on the last day. Great class!

Very good prof. He's into what he is teaching and his textbook is superb. Easy to understand & straight foward due to less "fancy" psychology words. Long written answer for exam is directly from textbook. Do the practise questions. Interesting class.
Enjoys what he teaches, but is boring.

This guy is one of the most engaging and entertaining profs in the school. Honestly, going to class was pointless except for the participation marks as the exams were 100% from the textbook. That being said, this guy is essentially a stand-up comedian up there! He is actually really funny! He'll make you love the course through his style and flair.

Total boss.  Lectures were interesting and full of awesome stories that were relevant to the course material.  Pretty much the only lecture that I fully enjoyed attending.  He tells you exactly what will be on the exam, and gives you the essay question.  All in all, a knowledgeable, friendly prof with a great sense of humor.

Prof  Hart is the BEST! Exams: super fair, straight out of the textbook. Lectures: interesting stories, even though exams were based out of the text i'd show up to class just to listen to Hart. He's super funny, easy to approach and an all around great guy. Take it with him if you can! Alana is a great TA as well.

He's fantastic! He clearly enjoys what he's doing, is more than happy to explain material and answer questions, and he wrote the textbook on Forensic Psychology -- Literally! I would take more forensic psyc classes just for him. His exams are really fair too.

Best prof I've had at SFU. He is hilarious! The class would be fairly boring if he wasn't the prof. He makes it incredibly interesting and gives lots of examples. The class has 2 midterms and a final. Memorize the text. Only complaint is the TM's marking. Definitely approach them about it if there are issues.

Good professor, exams are based out of the textbook (which he provided via PDF file, so we didn't have to purchase!) which was great! Funny and engages students. Good lectures, but can get away with not attending if you know your textbook material

Excellent teacher. Well-spoken, experienced, makes the material come alive. Too bad he doesn't mark the exams, as the TMs are limited in how they apply the marking guide. Tests are easy to do well on, hard to ace, but if you memorize the text, you can get full marks. One complaint - he is too busy to answer emails, it seems. But worth an8:30 wakeup

This prof is SO GOOD. He tells the funniest stories and makes the material entertaining and interesting. Make sure you read the textbook because he doesn't cover everything in lecture. I am planning on taking more of Dr. Hart's classes.

Great prof. When he said the exam is 1 hr long, he meant it (and gives you 2 hrs). Exams are easy if you have read the material. Very helpful and is willing to answer all kinds of questions. Lectures may be not very clearer for people who learn by reading, but it is fine for listeners.
